page.title: 04Acocks Green Centre
page.content: Acocks Green was once a small village but is now a suburb of south-east Birmingham. The Village is the main shopping area and there is a great variety of stores from which virtually anything can be bought. Housing in the area is a mixture of the old and the new. The large Victorian houses have either been demolished or turned into flats and offices. The modern housing consists mainly of small two or three bedroom houses. In recent years Acocks Green has enjoyed a revival; new firms and stores have opened bringing new life and increased business to the area. Its nearness to the National Exhibition Centre makes it a most convenient resting place for visitors to the many exhibitions held there.
